column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Hi Shanique - Thank you for your great review. I agree that our communal seating might not be for everyone
column2: but the design is essentially Japanese in terms of architecture and ergonomics. And in our defense
column3: for every awkward response by customers
column4: there are instances where new friends are made and spontaneous conversations are struck. I have even seen complete strangers offer food to one another other simply because someone said the dish they received looked appealing.
